name: Golden Chanterelle
habitat: Coast Live Oak, Tanoak, Canyon Live Oak
description: The California Golden Chanterelle is the largest chanterelle in the world. It grows in a symbiotic relationship with oak trees, particularly Coast Live Oak. Look for them in deep leaf litter under oaks, often on slopes.
recentStatus: Strong fruiting reported in late 2024/early 2025. Numerous observations in coastal counties (Sonoma, Santa Cruz, Bay Area) following seasonal rains.

name: Hedgehog Mushroom
habitat: Mixed hardwood (Tanoak, Madrone) and Conifers (Bishop Pine, Douglas Fir)
description: Distinguished by 'teeth' or spines under the cap instead of gills. H. umbilicatum (Bellybutton Hedgehog) is smaller with a central depression; H. repandum is larger.
recentStatus: Active season as of Dec 2025. Reports from Sonoma and Mendocino coasts indicate good fruiting conditions.

name: Black Trumpet
habitat: Tanoak, Madrone, Live Oak. Often in mossy banks.
description: A highly prized edible that is difficult to spot due to its dark color. It has a funnel shape and no true gills. Often grows in large troops.
recentStatus: Significant sightings (281+ obs) in late 2024/early 2025. Concentrated in coastal tanoak/madrone forests.

name: Candy Cap
habitat: Mixed hardwood/conifer, often on moss or rotting wood. Pine needles.
description: Famous for its intense maple syrup aroma when dried. Small, burnt-orange mushroom that exudes a milky latex when broken.
recentStatus: Peak season expected Jan 2025. Historical data suggests strong fruiting in coastal ranges.

name: King Bolete / Porcini
description: The 'King' of mushrooms. Massive, meaty stem and a sponge-like pore surface under the cap. Mycorrhizal with conifers.
recentStatus: Sporadic coastal fruiting reported Nov 2024. Coastal season typically peaks Oct-Jan.

name: Burn Morel
habitat: Conifer forests burned in the previous year (2024 fires).
description: Honeycomb-like cap. appear in massive numbers in the spring following a forest fire. Elevation dependent.
recentStatus: 2025 season just beginning. 2024 Park Fire and Smith River Complex burn scars are key targets.
